대사: @Good day^ sir. I'm here to ask you a few questions.@
@We're a newspaper^ not a city hall information center.@
@Do you know Mr. ⓖ(Aiden Triss)ⓦ? I'm here about him. At the request of Ms. ⓖ(Ella Triss)ⓦ.@
@You are a detective^ aren't you? No wonder you seemed shabby.@
@Anyway^ if it's ⓖ(Aiden's)ⓦ request... I'm his friend^ ⓖ(Berkeley Swain)ⓦ.@
@He's been in a lot of trouble lately. So maybe the problem is more serious after all?@
@Is it noticeable to others?@
@Phew... It's weird if don't notice^ he's changed his personality 180 degrees.@
@He was a good-natured and cheerful guy. But he said he couldn't sleep anymore^ eventually^ it came to this day.@
@I see.@
@I don't like being associated with kind of detective^ but if I can help ⓖ(Aiden)ⓦ^ I'll help you. Feel free to ask me anything.@
'I don't know he's attitude is good or bad.'☆①
@Why^ is there anything left to ask?@☆①
(The big man is sweating^ perhaps because of the hot weather.)
(The bulge in his pocket suggests he's carrying a pistol.)
'I guess he carries it as a weapon of restraint or intimidation.'
(I didn't notice anything in particular.)
(I brought up the question in response to a ⓡ(planetary parade)ⓦ article I read this morning.)
@Ah that's right^ you were a subscriber to our newspaper too. you have good taste^ that's my article.@
@Do you know anything more than what's in the papers?@
@Well... the astronomy department at ⓑ(●1ⓤMiskatonic University)ⓦ will set up their planetary observing equipment for the day and let us watch.@
@I see... Oh^ then^ do you know about ⓖ(Mr. Aiden's)ⓦ recent coverage?@
@hmm. It's an unspoken rule among reporters that we don't ask each other questions like that^ because if I do^ I might lose the story I'm working on.@
@I've heard there's been an epidemic of ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ lately.@
@Yeah^ that's what Bailey's been covering. Well... it's been hot and humid lately^ so maybe they're having trouble sleeping at night?@
@I'm not sure if it's for the same reason^ a lot of people have been reporting a strange ⓡ(●1ⓕfishy smell)ⓦ in the city lately.@
@In my opinion^ wouldn't it be a rotten fish that came in from the ⓑ(wharf)ⓦ.@
@Well^ I've never been one for dreams.@
@He's ⓡ(paranoid)ⓦ? I thought he prided himself on being physically and mentally healthy.@
@Did he not have any symptoms associated with it before?@
@Yeah^ he never had that problem before.@
@Do you know anything about ⓖ(Ms. Ella Trice)ⓦ?@
@Other than being ⓖ(Aiden's)ⓦ wife...@
@Did they have a good marriage?@
@As far as I know^ yes. At least I'm told they haven't had any major fights so far.@
@What can you tell us about ⓖ(Mr. Aiden)ⓦ?@
@He's always been full of vitality. There hasn't been any change in him since the first time he came in until now.@
@If being too passionate is a flaw^ it's a flaw. So he got hurt once in a while and his wife was very worried every time.@
@I can't believe it ended up like this... I hope he recovers soon.@
@I've been hired to find out why^ and I'm sure I will.@
@Of course you do^ because that's why they paid you to do.@
@How long have you been with this newspaper?@
@It's about 30 years now.@
@What do you think^ has anything special happened in Arkham lately?@
@It's unnaturally quiet to me.@
@Hmmm... I'm not sure if this is a hunch or a shot.@
@What do you mean?@
@Yeah^ well^ you might be able to help me. And no one would believe you if you told them.@
'This guy... clearly had a bad run-in with a detective.'
@What I'm about to do is something that very few people in Arkham know about^ you know what I mean?@
@You're telling me to watch my mouth.@
@It's good that you understand quickly. Anyway... to get down to business^ there's something special going on in Arkham lately.@
@There's been a recent spate of ⓡ(●1ⓜmissing people)ⓦ in Arkham. I've been investigating undercover for an exclusive story.@
@ⓡ(Missing people)ⓦ? I didn't hear anything in particular.@
@If it's a missing person's case^ shouldn't tell people about it so they can find it?@
@That's true^ but I think the police have a different view.@
@So far^ six people have been confirmed missing^ ranging from office workers to bigwigs.@
@The cause is unknown^ and not like they left something and disappeared...@
@It's continuous^ but it doesn't seem like there's a cause-and-effect relationship between these people.@
@What's clear is that people are continuing to disappear^ and it's not just any disappearance.@
@I see^ thanks for the information.@
@No^ don't thank me. You have your own sources.  Maybe you'll find something relevant in your investigation of ⓖ(Aiden)ⓦ.@
@Then give that information back to me as well.@
@You get something you didn't know^ and I get dangerous information safely. It's a give and take.@
@Okay^ we'll pass along any related stories as I Get to know.@
@Yes^ that's good.@
'While his demeanor pisses me off^ this is definitely good information.'
'Maybe if I ask ⓖ(Albert)ⓦor ⓖ(Maeve)ⓦ^ I can get some more information.'
@Well^ beyond that^ I don't know.@
@Shhh! Don't say that out loud! Are you going to ruin anything!?@
@I think your voice is louder now...@
@...Hmm do me a favor and let me know if you get any more information about the string of ⓡ(missing people)ⓦ.@
@I'll make sure you get paid. I'm doing an undercover story on it right now.@
@Okay^ so if ⓖ(Mr. Swain)ⓦ gets any new information^ please let me know too.@
@Let's do that.@
(His face brightens the most so far.)
@Hmm? What do you mean.@
(He doesn't seem very interested in this topic.)
@Oh^ I've heard that one before. A pet alligator lives in the sewer?@
@I wondered the same thing^ so I asked an acquaintance of mine^ and he told me that it's actually not possible.@
@If it was there in the first place^ the city would have taken care of it.@
@...Who am I kidding?@
(He frowned at me as if I were lying.)
